title: 108_hr5034
content: The "Randy Barrett Act" waives the 5-month waiting period for disability benefits for terminally ill beneficiaries. The Randy Barrett Act waives the waiting period for disability insurance benefits for terminally ill individuals under the Social Security Act. The Randy Barrett Act waives the waiting period for disability insurance benefits for terminally ill individuals under the Social Security Act, allowing those with a life expectancy of 12 months or less to receive widow's insurance benefits without delay. The Randy Barrett Act amends the Social Security Act to waive the waiting period for disability insurance benefits for terminally ill individuals with a life expectancy of 12 months or less, allowing them to receive widow's insurance benefits without delay. The Commissioner of Social Security waives the waiting period for widower's insurance benefits for terminally ill individuals with a life expectancy of 12 months or less. The Commissioner of Social Security will waive the 5-month duration requirement for terminally ill individuals with a life expectancy of 12 months or less to include the month in a period of disability. The amendments in this Act apply to specific benefits under the Social Security Act based on disability, with different effective dates for each type of benefit.
